p: Macroautophagy was discovered in the late 1950s using morphological techniques [ 81]. Being a principle degrading mechanism of the cell, macroautophagy contributes to the survival of cells under stressful conditions [ 69, 82]. Briefly, the cargo is sequestered into autophagosomes followed by their delivery to lysosomes for degradation [ 15]. There are many proteins involved in the autophagy pathway including ATG proteins. Thirty-two ATG proteins have been identified which play crucial roles in different steps of autophagy activation [ 81, 83â€“ 85].
